poem:
Title: "Elegy in the Spirit of Forgiveness"

In the jade valleys of schizophrenia,
a son is lost, a father found in death.
Failings bloom like dandelions in springtime,
In the castle of care, light seeps away.
Fault lines shake the corridors of justice,
In the mirrors of memory, he elopes,
Leaving both sorrow's echo and question's weight,
In his father's still, silent wake.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Serious care failings were a factor in son killing his father, coroner in Wales rules A string of serious failings in the care provided for a man with schizophrenia who killed his father an hour after absconding from a psychiatric ward contributed to the death, a coroner has ruled. Coroner Kirsten Heaven also said that security systems at the hospital where Daniel Harrison was being detained were inadequate and played their part in events leading". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
